what: Description of data needed for analysis
title: biosurvey: Preparing data
text: main goal biosurvey help users identify sites biodiversity inventory. package contains tools use environmental geographic information promote selection sites allow better sampling species region. data needed perform analyses : Environmental variables.- variables must raster format (e.g., GTiff, BIL, ASCII). load variables R environment, can use function stack package raster. Region interest.- analyses focused region, spatial polygon area needed. Common formats polygon can Shapefile, GeoPackage, GeoJSON, etc. load information R environment can use function readOGR rgdal package. Additionally, data can used make sampling site selection effective. functions help prepare data analysis also allow users include: Sites selected priori.- data.frame sites researchers consider important included set localities sampled. site(s) included (force) results obtained later analyses. Using sites represents good opportunity consider areas well known included monitor biodiversity changes region. mask restrict analyses smaller areas.- spatial polygon reduces region interest areas considered relevant analysis can considered. examples define masks include areas natural vegetation, areas accessible, regions particular vegetation cover types, etc. mask usually format Region interest. enough, good-quality data species distributions available, analyses effectiveness sampling sites can performed. data used prepare information perform analyses can different types: Spatial polygons species distributions Raster layers defining suitable unsuitable areas Geographic points species occurrences geographic projection objects coordinates involved analyses must WGS84 (EPSG:4326). Environmental geographic information needed select biodiversity survey sites (sampling sites). Information species distribution required, exists reliable, can used test effectiveness sampling sites selected based known species richness region interest.

what: Preparing an object that contains all information needed
title: biosurvey: Preparing data
text: following lines code help prepare S3 object (master_matrix) serve base perform analyses. object contain: 1) data_matrix, information geographic location raster cells, initial environmental data, principal components derived original data (PCs optional); 2) optional set preselected_sites; 3) spatial polygon representing region interest; 4) optional mask reduce region interest (restrict natural areas, instance); 5) spatial object serves raster_base used plotting purposes; 6) PCA_results, analysis used constructing master_matrix.  want define points need included final selection sites sampled, can adding data.frame one arguments function prepare_master_matrix. what: Selection of sites considering environmental uniformity and geographic patterns
title: biosurvey: Selecting sampling sites
text: goal type selection maximizing uniformity points environmental space, considering geographic patterns data. Similar environments (form block) disjoint geographic pattern (represented geographic various clusters) selected twice (consider biggest geographic clusters).  Now let’s check results selection environmental geographic spaces.   may noticed, points defined argument n_blocks function EG_selection. function explores environmental blocks geographic space defines two points geographic pattern points clustered.
code: # Selecting sites uniformly in E and G spaces EG_sel <- EG_selection(master = m_blocks, n_blocks = 10)  #> Element 'preselected_sites' in 'master' is NULL, setting #> 'use_preselected_sites' = FALSE #> Preparing data for analysis #> Selecting relevant environmental blocks, please wait... #> Running algorithm for selecting sites, please wait... #>     Process 1 of 10 #>     Process 2 of 10 #>     Process 3 of 10 #>     Process 4 of 10 #>     Process 5 of 10 #>     Process 6 of 10 #>     Process 7 of 10 #>     Process 8 of 10 #>     Process 9 of 10 #>     Process 10 of 10 #> Total number of sites selected: 15 # Plotting sites selected considering EG plot_sites_EG(EG_sel, selection_type = "EG")

title: biosurvey: Selecting sampling sites
text: Selecting survey sites randomly one multiple ways select places sample. Although can useful avoiding biases selection, recommended trying sample biodiversity region. following lines code allow users select survey sites based random selection available points. selection approach consider geographic environmental configurations. Note: going use object resulted previous process selection (master_selection object) allows add sets selected sites maintain results organized.  Checking sites selected randomly. Note selections type “random” “G” arguments “variable_1” “variable_2” need defined plotting function.
code: # Number of sites nsites <- nrow(EG_sel$selected_sites_EG$selection_1)  # Selecting sites randomly EG_r_selection <- random_selection(EG_sel, n_sites = nsites, n_samplings = 5)  #> Element 'preselected_sites' in 'master' is NULL, setting #> 'use_preselected_sites' = FALSE #> Selecting sampling sites randomly #> Total number of sites selected: 15 # Plotting selected sites plot_sites_EG(EG_r_selection, selection_type = "random", variable_1 = "PC1",                variable_2 = "PC2")

Default = 1. main main title plot. Default = NULL. xlab label x-axis. Default = NULL. ylab label y-axis. Default = NULL. xlim x limits plot (x1, x2). plot_PAM_CS, default, NULL, uses range normalized richness. ylim y limits plot. plot_PAM_CS, default, NULL, uses range normalized values dispersion field. second limit increased adding result multiplying ylim_expansion, add_legend = TRUE. ylim_expansion value used expanding ylim. Default = 0.25. las style axis labels; default = 1. See par. add_legend (logical) whether add legend describing information relevant interpreting diagram. Default = TRUE. xy_coordinates required PAM_CS class PAM_CS. matrix data.frame containing columns longitude latitude (order) corresponding points PAM_CS$S_significance_id.
